instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Don't know where to start here.  Board was very lightly water damaged.  Has a bit of corrosion on <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> and keyboard connector.  cleaned both off.  Board has green/orarange light and fan spins but no chime and does not boot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: where would that be?  its not showing up on board view

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> at first had 1.8...then 10 seconds later is now short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: CPU getting warm or staying cold? Probably corrosion somewhere. The usual suspects are <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and traces to its crystal, crap under SMC, possible <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
cpu is getting warm.

<CHIP>U1900</CHIP>
1- 3.32
2- 3.32
3-.984
4-1.056
5-3.32
6-1.182
8-.556
12-.429
13-3.42
14-3.309
15-1.64
should i replace it?

the only corrosion i saw was around <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>.  I took that off and cleaned it and put it back.  should i replace it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Inspect closer for corrosion. Also look at CPU Vcore, does it come on then off and then on again?
